articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LISBON LION Bertie Auld was one of the key components in Jock Stein’s all-conquering Celtic team of the sixties. The [...]

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: One of the surprising elements when we compare Celtic and Newco’s accounts is that the former have a higher wage bill: Celtic, £60m; Newco, £64m, despite Celtic having a bonus liability for winning all three trophies.  The variance is even more stark than it looks.  Celtic’s wage figure includes 130 retail staff, Newco’s retail operation [...]
articles.title: Celtic-Newco financials: Celtic’s huge advantage

articles.description: CELTIC legends Neil Lennon and Scott Brown have been linked with the manager’s job at Ross County. Lennon and Brown, the manager and captain who dovetailed to guide the Parkhead club to a phenomenal quadruple treble [...]
articles.title: CELTIC LEGENDS IN BOSS LINK

articles.description: ANGE POSTECOGLOU quit Celtic in June only a couple of days after sealing a world record eighth domestic silverware clean sweep. Forty-eight hours after the 3-1 Scottish Cup Final win over Inverness Caley Thistle at Hampden on Saturday June 3, the Greek-Australian boss was on his way to Spurs. Postecoglou’s two-year reign at Parkhead ended [...]

Okunuki, who has called into his country’s senior [...]

articles.author: Michael Shearer
articles.description:
Former Celtic defender Mark Wilson was full of praise for his former side after yesterday's win highlighting the 6-0 victory over Aberdeen as a perfect response. 
Celtic went into yesterday's match with some doubts surrounding the Bhoys in how they would react after Tuesday's 6-0 loss to Atletico Madrid in the Champions League. 
The post Sky Sports pundit refutes criticism levelled at Brendan Rodgers' Celtic squad appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Sky Sports pundit refutes criticism levelled at Brendan Rodgers' Celtic squad

articles.author: Michael Shearer
articles.description:
Chris Sutton has defended Celtic after journalist Ian Ladyman questioned why Brendan Rodgers returned to the Hoops.
In an article he wrote last week for the Daily Mail, Ladyman expressed his opinion that Rodgers is squandering his best years as a manager at Celtic. However, Sutton disagreed with Ladyman's remarks.
The post Chris Sutton launches furious defence of Celtic against "badly wrong" English criticism appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Chris Sutton launches furious defence of Celtic against "badly wrong" English criticism

articles.author: Michael Shearer
articles.description:
Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers highlighted Luis Palma and Hyunjun Yang for praise after their performances in Celtic's 6-0 destruction of Aberdeen. 
Yang and Palma, who both joined Celtic in the summer, were both able to get on the scoresheet yesterday in a sensational performance from the Hoops, with Palma also registering a hat-trick of assists.
The post "You see the development"; Brendan Rodgers comments on emerging Celtic duo bode very well appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: "You see the development"; Brendan Rodgers comments on emerging Celtic duo bode very well

articles.author: Michael Shearer
articles.description:
Former Celtic goalkeeper Packie Bonner hailed Celtic's character after an incredible 6-0 win against Aberdeen saw the Bhoys go eight points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership.
Celtic dominated Aberdeen from start to finish in their biggest win of the season despite the announcement of Daizen Maeda's injury on Friday. 
Hyunjun Yang opened the scoring for Celtic just nine minutes into the game, with Kyogo Furuhashi adding another after 16 minutes. Although they had to wait just over 60 minutes for their third goal, the Bhoys were clearly the dominant side and could have won the game by an even greater margin.
The post BBC Sportsound pundit raves about Celtic after routing Aberdeen with two standouts highlighted appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: BBC Sportsound pundit raves about Celtic after routing Aberdeen with two standouts highlighted

articles.author: Michael Shearer
articles.description:
Former Celtic striker Chris Sutton hailed two Celtic stars as tremendous after yesterday's 6-0 win over Aberdeen.
After a tough midweek match against Atletico Madrid, Celtic bounced back against Aberdeen with a convincing victory, despite doubts about the team due to injuries to Daizen Maeda, Reo Hatate, and Liel Abada.
The post Chris Sutton names two 'tremendous' players in Celtic win  appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Chris Sutton names two 'tremendous' players in Celtic win
